extends javax.swing.JFrame

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  GameScreen.ChoiceListener
      Any mouse events regarding the choice labels is handled here
      private class  GameScreen.SoundButtonListener
      Used when the sound button is clicked, will disable sound if enabled, and vice versa.

        private Game game
        Used as the game logic for this Screen. Uses Game to play the actual game, allows us to trigger rounds on GameScreen.ChoiceListener

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameScreen

        public GameScreen(int difficulty,
          int rounds)
        Create the frame and populate it with the choices and the stats panel
        Parameters:
        difficulty - denotes the type of game played, 1 = RandomAI, 2 = StateAI, 3 = IntelligentAI.

    • Method Detail

      • setDifficulty

        private void setDifficulty(int difficulty,
                 int rounds)
        Instantiates the game with the given difficulty Instantiates the Game with the given difficulty to identify the Entity to be used.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - denotes the type of game played, 1 = RandomAI, 2 = StateAI, 3 = IntelligentAI.
        rounds -

      • createStatsPane

        private javax.swing.JPanel createStatsPane()
        Creates the stats labels container, gives inital values. Creates the stats JPanel and gives the inital values, these are generally not taken from Game to help usability.
        Returns:
        the JPanel containing all of the stats

      • createContentPane

        private javax.swing.JPanel createContentPane()
        Creates the main panel and adds all the relevent components to it Creates the JPanel that is to be used for the main arrangement of the JFrame components.
        Returns:
        the Panel to be added to the frame

      • createChoicePane

        private javax.swing.JPanel createChoicePane()
        Creates the Panel holding the choices that are available to the user. Creates the JPanel and populates it with the three JLabel that are avaliable to the user.
        Returns:
        the JPanel holding the possible choices

      • createSoundLabel

        private javax.swing.JLabel createSoundLabel()
        Creates the sound label with its icon. Instantiates lblSound, sets its inital ImageIcon and adds the listener.
        Returns:
        the JLabel created in this method.

      • updateSoundLabel

        private void updateSoundLabel()
        Updates the sound labels image depending on inital state. Updates lblSound depending on if the user wants sound to play or not. This is indicated by playSound.

      • makeVisible

        public void makeVisible()
        Displays the screen to the user

      • setRound

        private void setRound()
        Gives the round label a value. Sets the lblRound text value, values taken from Game.

      • setUserScore

        private void setUserScore()
        Gives the user score label a value. Sets the lblUserScore text value, values taken from Game.

      • setEnemyScore

        private void setEnemyScore()
        Gives the enemy score label a value. Sets the lblEnemyScore text value, values taken from Game.

      • setDraws

        private void setDraws()
        Gives the draw label a value. Sets the lblDraws text value, values taken from Game.

      • createScreen

        private void createScreen()
        Creates the screen and its properties. Sets the JFrame default values, anything specific to the screen itself when no components are involved should be updated here.

      • createOutcomePane

        private javax.swing.JPanel createOutcomePane()
        Creates the container for the outcome. Creates the JPanel in which the user and enemies choice will be shown.
        Returns:
        the JPanel with its format, labels are added later

      • createChoiceLabel

        private javax.swing.JLabel createChoiceLabel(java.lang.String text,
                                   javax.swing.ImageIcon image)
        Creates a clickable label that represents a choice for the user. Uses a JLabel that is linked to GameScreen.ChoiceListener that allows it to be clickable.
        Parameters:
        text - indicates the text to go under the image in the label
        image - indicates the image that the label will hold
        Returns:
        a JLabel that represents a choice

      • refreshScreen

        private void refreshScreen()
        Forces the JFrame to refresh making sure that all components are properly updated immediately.

      • removeOutcome

        private void removeOutcome()
        Removes all labels from the outcomePane so that others can be added.

      • createOutcomeLabel

        private javax.swing.JLabel createOutcomeLabel(int choice,
                                    java.lang.String userType,
                                    java.awt.Color color)
        Creates a label that represents one of the chosen values by either the player or other entity. Creates a specific JLabel with an ImageIcon corresponding to the choice made.
        Parameters:
        choice - indicates the value they chose, 1 = rock, 2 = paper, 3 = scissors
        userType - indicates the type entities type, either user or enemy
        color - indicates the colour of the border, this represents the outcome
        Returns:
        the JLabel that represents the chosen value

      • setChoiceBorder

        private void setChoiceBorder(int value,
                   java.awt.Color color,
                   int width)
        Updates choice label to have a different border. Gives one of the choice JLabel a border of set Color with a set width.
        Parameters:
        value - indicates what label to give a border too
        color - indicates the colour of the border
        width - indicates the width of the border

      • resetBorder

        private void resetBorder()
        Gives every choice JLabel their normal border

      • setOutcomePane

        private void setOutcomePane()
        Displays the user and enemies choice to the screen. Display the outcomePane of the GameScreen, indicates whether the user won, lost or drew and what theirs and the enemies choices were.
        Parameters:
        userChoice - users values, indicates what they picked
        enemyChoice - enemies values, indicates what they picked
        result - indicates the message to be shown to the user

      • getUserColor

        private java.awt.Color getUserColor(int result)
        Converts the result for the Player as to what the colour of their JLabel will be
        Parameters:
        result - indicates the result, 3 = win, 2 = draw, 1 = lose
        Returns:
        the colour representing the outcome for the user

      • getEnemyColor

        private java.awt.Color getEnemyColor(int result)
        Converts the result for the enemy as to what the colour of their JLabel will be
        Parameters:
        result - indicates the result, 3 = lose, 2 = draw, 1 = win
        Returns:
        the colour representing the outcome for the enemy

      • updateScreen

        private void updateScreen()
        Updates the screen to reflect game outcome. Updates every JLabel and the outcomePane.
